Salary is a little low compared to other places I've worked but they offer work from and it's hard to put a price on that. 
Benefits could be a bit better.

job_title: Case Manager Specialist in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Great culture, very intelligent CEO (love to listen to him speak, instills pride!), very competitive salary, supportive management, opportunity for growth is there if you work for it. Pay for performance!!
cons: I worked previously for a very non-supportive supervisor but was able to join a different team and that was my only gripe since I started. Totally not the majority at Cigna. It's a great company.

pros: This is a employer which values their employees. Employees are compensated better than most other places of employment hiring interns. Everyone is great to work with and there is a strong team environment
cons: Underwriting is simply not an enjoyable field. It was good experience for an internship, but not something I would want to do for the next ten years.

review_title: Really great company to work for
pros: There is always new updates being made to help. Management cares about your well being. There is room to advance through the company. Great paid time off, and other benefits.
cons: There is limited sick days. Health Insurance is not bad, but could be better. There is some micromanagement.

review_title: A good place to work but limited growth opportunity
job_title: Medical Administrative Associate in Nashville, TN
pros: Work from home, flex schedule,  tuition reimbursement, decent pay, my team/dept. has a wonderful manager.
cons: Pay is below market standards, health insurance is sub-par with high deductibles and premiums are higher than expected given you're employed by a health insurance company. Small raises while bonuses seem to be given to higher management instead of front line employees.

job_title: Medicare Customer Service Representative in Houston, TX
pros: Pay, weekends off, unlimited overtime, work space, room for growth.
cons: Medical benefits are not good at all. Only HSA or HRA available. Training is 6 weeks but very broad. As a CSR, you handle benefits and pharmacy calls which are complex. Way too many systems in order to perform the job. Due to system access not being requested until the last 2 weeks of training, no training was provided on how to use them properly.

pros:
The interview process was relatively simple. Make sure when they ask you to tell them about a time... you are specific. Give the situation, what you did, and the outcome.
The pay is competitive.
cons:
The insurance can be quite expensive when getting actual services.
The management techniques can be quite contradictory. 
The training needs some work. The first few weeks may not pertain to your actual job at all.

job_title: Senior Compliance Manager in Bloomfield, CT
pros: Bonuses but only if the manager is ethical. Work from home flexibility.
cons: Revolving door of managers due to the inadequate vetting during the hiring process. Don't be surprised if you get hired and are let go with in a few months, very common. Poor development of employees. Training resources are limited and external training is prohibited due to budget restrictions. Excessive work hours 12 -14 is a standard day. Lack of documented Goals , Roles and Responsibilities for employees.

job_title: Senior Compliance Manager in Bloomfield, CT
pros: Bonuses but only if the manager is ethical. Work from home flexibility.
cons: Revolving door of managers due to the inadequate vetting during the hiring process. Don't be surprised if you get hired and are let go with in a few months, very common. Poor development of employees. Training resources are limited and external training is prohibited due to budget restrictions. Excessive work hours 12 -14 is a standard day. Lack of documented Goals , Roles and Responsibilities for employees.

review_title: Great in some ways, terrible in others.
job_title: Accounting Senior Analyst in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Younger CEO that is moving the company in a better direction.  Lots of opportunities to learn and grow professionally.
cons: Worst health insurance benefits I have ever received, raises fall far below inflation, very tough to advance, lots of politics in certain areas of the company.

pros:
Flexibility
Lots of advancement opportunity for those who perform well and network within the organization
Focus on health and wellness of employees and communities in which we work
Opportunities to volunteer time in the community
cons:
Technology is a bit behind
Consumer directed health benefits are progressive, but often end up meaning increased out of pocket costs

review_title: Cigna is a really great place to work
pros: It's innovative and leadership is excellent. You get the feeling that the leadership is taking the company in the right direction with the right strategy.
cons: Like all big companies there is a lot of red tape for moving around and getting things done between all the different departments.

review_title: Getting some experience and then getting out.
pros: It was easy to get in the door.  It is a large company with many areas of opportunity.
cons: This company has antiquated procesess and systems, uneducated and inexperienced employees, and little to no quality control.

review_title: I had a fairly long and satisfying career
job_title: Senior QA Specialist in Bloomfield, CT
pros: I moved from Bloomfield to NC and was allowed to work remotely with minimal supervision. I also had access to a remote office if needed.
cons: Too much annual turnover from testers to upper management, and every year the Business Teams promised too much to the end users just to satisfy the stakeholders.

job_title: Data Entry Associate in Bloomfield, CT
pros: great opportunity to work with bright, energetic people on cutting edge technology projects.  Campus was very nice, good facilities and after work activities
cons: Lots of politics and bureaucracy, secrecy in upper management, often felt too cutthroat.   Working for a public company means always managing to a 90 day plan, which can greatly increase stress

review_title: Don't count on getting vacation days you want
pros: Work is relatively easy, hours are good, work from home opportunities
cons: Required to bid for days off (and may only bid for 6 months at a time). Bidding order is determined by metrics, not seniority. Depending on the size of the department, it can be virtually impossible to get the days off that you want, especially around holidays.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, KS
pros:
- Team dynamic is great. If you need help or questions management and co-workers are more than willing.
- Work from home culture gives flexibility.
- PTO is great, gets better with time and higher career bands.
- Continuous on the job training keeps employees knowledgeable and up to date on product/system changes.
cons:
- Can get hectic when busy season rolls around.
- Surprisingly expensive health insurance for an insurance company. 
- Big corporate culture can sometimes slow changes.

job_title: Procurement Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Work from home, flexibility, decent pay, ability to advance if hardworking, most colleagues are great.
cons: Workload is unreasonable and greatly exacerbated by the merger. Health benefits are bad, which is unacceptable for a health insurance Co. Processes are cumbersome, too much administrative time wasted. Ariba integration very poorly handled.

pros: The best thing about working a cigna is that I have a job.
cons:
-Cigna review process is the WORST!!!!!
-Cigna will post a job when its already taken.
-No matter how hard you work or how good of a job you do  if your not part of a CLIQUE you will not   go far.
--Low Level managers are unskilled
-No diversity
-

review_title: Never should have merged with Cigna.
pros: I worked their 3 yrs before Cigna acquired. I enjoyed the experience that I gained and loved the people that I worked with.  Until, Cigna took over.  Everything changed.  Pay was not competitive and turn over was horrible.
cons: No connection between departments..Too many chiefs and not enough Indians.  Your role changed frequently, usually stuck doing data entry because if the lack of qualified staff.

review_title: Challenging work life balance with friendly environment ?
pros: Friendly environment, average remuneration, open minded staff, possibility of having work life balance, flexible working place, highly recommended for people with slow pace character with side job
cons: management are too busy with the business but doesn't seem focus on their decision making, HR need to develop clear job framework for all employee levels, unclear parameter for career improvement, unclear career path

review_title: Run away for your own health and sanity
pros: The only positive is the paycheck deposits into your account on time. Other than that there is no good reason to work here whatsoever.
cons: Where to begin? Incompetent leadership, nepotism, blatant favoritism, discrimination, and large bureaucracies where little gets accomplished run rampant here. Little wonder Cigna is being acquired by another company. The organization is a case study in greed, inefficiency, and ineptitude.

review_title: Disappointed in IT's senior leadership team
pros:
. People, who care more than management
. Opportunity to move around within the company
cons:
. HR who is in the pocket of mgmt
. IT Senior and Mid level mgmt who are busy creating bureaucracy instead of promoting collaboration
. Poor university hire and emerging leader program, seen a lot of promising Gen Y and Nexters disappointed and no support system
. Not open to new ways of thinking

review_title: Overall, was an excellent company to work, but earlier years with the company were much more favorable.
job_title: Systems Analysis Manager in Bloomfield, CT
pros: I took advantage of development opportunities and worked my way up to a comfortable level and thoroughly enjoyed my job.  It wasn't a simple job, and I worked hard.
cons: After the 80s, 90s mergers, paternalistic attitudes disappeared and unrealistic expectations were the norm.  Tense working environments.

pros: Great support and opportunities to grow from within. Cigna is a forward thinking company and is global. Jobs turn into careers at Cigna.
cons: None that I can think of. This company is dynamic and is very flexible in its freedom of working at home, at the client onsite or at the company headquarters.

pros: I really enjoyed the size of the company and the ease at which promotions were available for those who worked for them. I transitioned to working from home after just a little over a year in the office and the transition was seamless.
cons: You would think that when you work for a health insurance company, you would have pretty inexpensive health insurance, right? Nope, and employees dont even have the best plan avialable to other accounts. The insurance was good - just expensive.

pros: Good benefits, good salary, Nice staff to work with , Supervisors are nice
cons: Hostile work environment, Senior Managers not working together, No investment in technology, Good workers just get more work

pros: office atmosphere , benefits , cafeteria .
cons: After doing 2 months of training for medicare PPO plan we kept getting pulled in to do more trainings to do more jobs . only to get paid the exact same  and do more work. when I worked at other health insurance companies you would get paid more to do pharmacy (its own animal)  , enrollments (commission) , claims &  to teach other plans NOT HERE.

review_title: Wonderful, flexible workplace for those with technical skills and dedicated work ethics.
pros: flexibility of work environment and hours
cons: sedentary work, and duties can have overlapping deadlines.  Great for someone with good time management skills though.

review_title: A solid internship experience for anyone in the IT/Business field.
pros: Very well established intern program, many different departments and roles to observe.  Built in feedback and group events help to keep the summer experience flowing smoothly.  Compensation is above average plus housing was provided.
cons: Depending on where one is placed, there can be unattentative management or too light or heavy of a work load.

pros: Managing large complicated projects which will prepare you for being a PM anywhere.  Very supportive community, friendly environment. The Bloomfield office is very nice (recently remodeled) and very commuteable from North, South, East...  Compensation seems to be 10% higher then competitors for the same position.
cons: Lotsof bureacracy which impacts the ability to deliver.  Lack of any formal training makes it a struggle at times for new hires.  It's also a Healthcare company!!

pros: Great co-workers, alot of opportunity, people have a wealth of knowledge, good pay, ample time off, truly does care about their employees and clients.
cons: Constant flux, re-orgs, and changes. Clients like stability when it comes to the team that services them and I don't think Cigna always does the best job at that.

review_title: Excellent company with great opportunities for career growth!
job_title: Business Project Manager in Scranton, PA
pros: I've been afforded a lot of opportunities and been able to maximize my potential at Cigna. Also, in my role I am able to have a flexible work schedule and work from home when necessary.
cons: There are times that we have to work under pretty tight deadlines which translates into some late night work and a loss of the work/life balance. It doesn't happen all the time but can be tough when it does happen.

pros: I loved working for this company. Worked with a small group of peers, and we were a FAMILY.  There was genuine concern for the members, and their well-being.
cons: Some of the management didn't like to hear the voice of the workers.  Often had to repeatedly fax the same documents into coding which was very time consuming.

pros: Loved my co-workers. Good flexibility.  Thought my compensation was very fair. Very good career mobility internally. Employee welfare benefits were solid.
cons: There are still some of the long time workers who are quite entrenched and not particularly pleasant to work with.  But that's increasingly rare as they begin to retire.

job_title: Business Operations Specialist in Penn, PA
pros: Great opportunities, matching 401k contribution.
cons: Old management styles which aren’t conducive to the business future growth and industry competition. Health insurance options are poor for employees. PTO doesn’t roll over which is not good.

pros: Lots of friendly staff, nice facility, and pay was on the upper end of the scale.
cons: I would have expected better benefits from an insurance company and the holidays off are the least generous of any place I've worked.  They could hire and retain more talent by increasing the benefits/health care.

review_title: No advancement opportunities.  The pay isn't market comparable for some roles.   Very top heavy.
job_title: Senior Care Assistant in Phila, PA
pros: Most mgrs are flexible and understanding, while there are a few who micro-manage.  Very laid back enivorment.
cons: poor internal opportunities for advancement, they trap you in a career band which limit financial growth.  Upper management is petty, when it comes to sharing information pertaining to your job performance.

job_title: Senior Accounting Manager in Austin, TX
pros: Large company, good experience at seeing how one works - trying to coordinate many, many different functions across the global enterprise.
cons: I don't think people managing specific divisions know what the hell they are doing.  It appears that the automatic way to get promoted to one of these position is to serve time in the Cigna army by going abroad and putting in time on behalf of the company there.  Sure, the experience is good for these folks, but in no way does it make them qualified to make sweeping decision across a broad range of business services in the United States.

job_title: LTD Claim Manager in Glendale, CA
pros: flexible hours and work from home options, which saves you a lot of time in commute and traffic as well as gas
cons: everything else. the work load is out of this world, and no clear plan in the future to improve the situation

pros: No micro managing, no time sheets, some friendly co workers.
cons: Lack of training, lack of resources, lack of reference tools, lack of advanced technology, no feedback on performance, no feedback on growth, just sink or swim mentality.   But a job in this economy is not easy to come by these days.........

pros: good benefits and pay.  Nice co-workers.  Good work.
cons: Mgmt treats people disrespectfully and with attitude.  Mgmt fosters an environment of non-collaboration and partnership.  They show very little respect and gratitude for older workers and show extreme deference to younger ones.   Mgmt preaches work/life balance, "aha moments", mindfulness and the need to take breaks, but doesn't allow anyone to do any of that.  Basically, mgmt is two-faced.

pros: Relaxed atmosphere flexible hours well paying for area fair amount of pto incentives and team atmosphere
cons: Not a lot of room for advancement. Salary increases are small even for high performers. Issues for mid level experienced employees finding further opportunities internally

pros: Hours, work from home is ok when it's allowed. That's all I have good to say. I have to write 20 words.
cons: The training is horrible! The expectations are high. There is a lot of turn over. The culture is weird. They don't have coffee for their employees and it's a corporation! They micro manage. You have to clock in and track your work. The have a daly huddle and do a role call. This is for a grown adult. It's a shame.  I never have worked in an environment that I hated so much!

pros: Great pay, PTO, and retirement. Lots of opportunities to move into new positions after 18 months. It's also possible to work at home full time or part time after 1 year.
cons: This role has evolved tremendously since I first started and I don't particularly enjoy it anymore.

job_title: UI/User Experience Designer in Bloomfield, CT
pros: Competitive salaries, easy to move around and advance in the company, great benefits. Great development and leadership programs.
cons: Not the best environment for creative thinking, the workplace culture lacks morale and can be hostile at times. The introduction of new work flows has created confusion and hot tempers among the majority of the people I work with. Recently, departments have been facing multiple reorgs over the past year.

job_title: Personal Advocate in Eden Prairie, MN
pros: I gained great experience in customer service and administrative work, coming right out of college. Great place to work before receiving a masters in behavioral health, or other fields,  as they will help employees pay for schooling.
cons: Long hours sitting at a desk. Schedule is very structured, with low flexibility. PTO often got denied.

review_title: BOD met 2 decide 2 B dropped off block from building for qtrly meeting so we didn't see them get out of limos
pros: Nice work-life balance at CIGNA.
cons: Forced rankings, low pay, corporate greed.

pros:
Promote from within department.
Annual bonus if department goals are met.
Annual pay raise based on performance. 
Some jobs offer work from home with VPN.
cons:
Could expand work at home capabilities for many jobs but doesn't. 
Job search engine is one of the worst I've seen.
Difficult to move outside of current department to a different area.
Healthcare Reform is eliminating jobs in some areas.

review_title: The perfect blend of work and play
pros: Young and dynamic workforce, vibrant office culture, variety of actuarial roles (functional as well as product lines) to choose from, possibilities to enter Cigna's international track
cons: Salary & bonus structures for younger FSA's are not as competitive as some other insurance firms and consulting houses, location can be an issue if you prefer big cities

pros: Lots of PTO, good 401k matching, lots of emphasis on personal and professional development, tuition reimbursement is OK, challenging assignments abound, embraces work at home/remote employees, Cordani has a great strategic vision for the company
cons: Terrible health benefits, work/life balance is hit or miss depending on team/project, bureaucratic & rigid culture in many IT orgs

pros: Pay is competitive. Leadership seems energized.  There are a lot of smart people here who are invested in advancing the company.
cons: Many silos - very quiet work environment where people rarely peek out from their cube and office.  Straight-laced. It often felt like individuals were out for themselves - "team work" was just a facade.  Did not enjoy working here - never felt welcome.

job_title: Telemarketing Senior Associate in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Seemingly easy work as long as they don't have you do another department job for 4 months because they didn't staff them correctly.
cons: This is a salary and commission job. You're paid off how many prescriptions you move to home delivery but they often set the quotas middle of the month. Being a top performer doesn't better your chances for promotions or higher positions. Management doesn't seem to know what is policy and what is hearsay.

review_title: Good place to get your foot in the door, but not much movement to other depts avail
pros: The healthcare industry is a great place to be right now.
cons: Favoritism and its hard to move around in company--seems like they prefer to hire outside candidates instead of moving their own people.

job_title: IT Business Analysis Specialist in Nashville, TN
pros: Learn about Medicare Advantage and working together in teams to meet the same objective. They are really involved in the community. It is wonderful to see they are willing to take care of their members and keep claim cost down.
cons: Lack of management support and decision follow through. Most of the staff is scared to share information due to the Cigna take over. The business units are too spread out and do not interact as much as they should. Training is lacking.

review_title: Unimpressed and uninspired work force lead by inexperienced management.
pros: Great benefits such as healthcare/ dental, social events organised regularly and incentivised overtime, flexible shifts to suit work/ life balance.
cons: Inexperienced management team lead to procedural mistakes within corporate business, long hours required to achieve decent salary as basic is paid at less than market rate, which is openly discussed.

pros: Started out an excellent place to work and an excellent chance for knowledge and onsite training skills. Team environment is very strong, I really enjoyed to relationships I developed with my coworkers, supervisor and direct manager.
cons: They told us on a Monday morning to dial in on a team bridge call on Thursday, when we dialed in we were informed that we were all terminated - this was suddenly and without warning.

review_title: Not the best company to work for
job_title: Senior Customer Service Representative in Moosic, PA
pros: Great opportunity for growth if you're a really fast learner, good opportunity for raises/bonuses [again, if you do well]
cons: Awful work [insurance customers are among the worst], mediocre management, quite a bit of information and standard operating procedures change seemingly non-stop, growth is very dependent on the department you start in

pros: Lots of training, opportunities to increase your earnings, education via affiliation with other insurance/brokerage/payroll/systems groups. A modern, paperless office atmosphere being built and Senior Management is accessible and engaged. Best of all lots of customer contact for most positions and the environment is one of respect, fellowship and supportive competition.They are building a new Insurance Broker model.
cons: Getting to Cambridge can sometimes be tough

pros: Flex work schedule, work at home, decent pay, some autonomy depending on manager. Team atmosphere. Good PTO and holiday days.
cons: Lots of ambiguity around roles and responsibilities. Frustrating upper management. Year end discussions are mostly BS. Not much for career growth paths from management. Be careful of providing honest feedback.

review_title: A company that is making its way into the twenty-first century
pros: Opportunity to work with talented staff.  A collaborative environment amongst peers.  Nice work station accommodations.  Good benefits and competitive compensation.
cons: They are definitely behind the technology curve.  But they are making efforts to catch up.  There is resistance in abandoning old practices/processes and wholly adopting new ones.

pros: It's a safe, comfortable job where you might not be challenged by your day-to-day work. But hey, some people are looking for that right? For the most part, the pay is very fair and good. There's a high turnover for some reason.
cons: But it's also incredibly competitive, a bit catty, and the lunchroom feels like high school. Most insurance companies, especially global ones, are moving to a work from home environment. Cigna isn't.

pros: Constant interaction with other countries (US, Belgium, China). Global projects.
cons: There is no career at all.

pros: Great managers. They are very helpful. Education reimbursement. Opportunities to learn more in other departments. Opportunities for overtime.
cons: You cannot work here if you have no back bone. You must be able to handle difficult calls and irrate customers. Sometimes this will be a daily issue.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Horsham, PA
pros:
-Management is concerned for the well being and happiness of employees.
-Detail oriented training that allows staff to learn at their best individual pace.
-All areas of the facilities are clean and well organized.
-Periodic team building events, making for a good overall atmosphere on a daily basis.
cons:
-PTO system implied as opposed to vacation/sick days. 
-Facility closing result in automatic usage of PTO for employees scheduled when it happens.

job_title: LTD Claim Manager II in Plano, TX
pros: Each day was different and felt like investigator putting all the pieces of the puzzle together; work content enjoyable. Believe in promoting from within and one can work themselves up through the company.
cons: Cannot complete workload without overtime and very poor work-life balance. But if you did complete your workload, you were rewarded with more work. There isn't formal management training and my boss had no managerial skills what-so-ever.

job_title: Onsite Health Coach in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Cigna is nationwide and has a large number of resources available.  They are are open to working remotely which makes it convenient for those outside of an office area and makes it effective to work without being micro managed.
cons: The company is big and changes occur very slowly.  There seems to be meetings to have meetings but the progress is slow.

review_title: Values bottom line over customers or employees
pros: Big company with lots of perks, potential for bonuses, employee resource groups, employee assistance programs etc
cons: Insurance benefits are expensive, management doesn't understand how much the employees contibute to the success of the whole.  If you aren't in sales they really don't care or see your value. Lots of outsourcing to save the bottom line instead of investing in talented individuals.

job_title: Onsite Health Coach in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Cigna is nationwide and has a large number of resources available.  They are are open to working remotely which makes it convenient for those outside of an office area and makes it effective to work without being micro managed.
cons: The company is big and changes occur very slowly.  There seems to be meetings to have meetings but the progress is slow.

review_title: Values bottom line over customers or employees
pros: Big company with lots of perks, potential for bonuses, employee resource groups, employee assistance programs etc
cons: Insurance benefits are expensive, management doesn't understand how much the employees contibute to the success of the whole.  If you aren't in sales they really don't care or see your value. Lots of outsourcing to save the bottom line instead of investing in talented individuals.

review_title: Many fine people, finance runs it though.
pros:
Good Pay.  
Big high concept projects and large scale of databases.
cons: Long decision cycle leaves business users dissatisfied.  Too many layers of management and control.  Six Sigma is a manufacturing stratagem, not suited to financial services.

review_title: Company keeps forgetting that it is not number one in the market.
pros: Good product set, some interesting new projects to get involved with, many industry smart people working at the company.
cons: Company is spread way too thin . . . involved in many more markets and initiatives, then they can effectively execute.  Strong industry smarts, many times, prevents management from making the right business decision.

review_title: The people are great, but the IT support and infrastructure is poor for such a large company.
pros: The products and people are good.    I like making a difference in other peoples lives.  It is rewarding for me.
cons: The benefits plan is subpar.   Our healthcare benefits cost too much and assume that you will never get hurt or sick.

review_title: My experience with Cigna was awful!
job_title: Business Analyst in Eden Prairie, MN
pros: The hours are flexible. The rank and file are pretty decent folks. The amount of vacation time received is good.
cons: The management is ambiguous and disappointing.  It is like working inside of a Charlie Brown comic strip.  You hear the muffled adult sounds, you have the football pulled away at the last moment, and only the dog makes sense.  It is a waste of time to work here.

job_title: IT Project Manager in Bloomfield, CT
pros: Ability to move around to different roles within the company every few years, which keeps work interesting.  Competitive compensation.
cons: As I've seen with many large companies - need to deal with 'corporate politics' & can be lots of red tape when trying to deliver your project.

job_title: Regiional Sales Manager in Westlake Village, CA
pros: Wonderful Company to work for!!  The management was superb.
cons: I'm sorry I cant think of any.

review_title: The best place to start my career
job_title: Applications Development Specialist in Nashville, TN
pros: Cigna offers a complete range of various positions and I could not be happier to start my first career out of college here. The thoughtfulness and consideration put into the on-boarding experience is only shadowed by the quality of management and other personnel. With offices all over the world and various early career development programs Cigna has something to offer any ambitious worker.
cons: Being such a fast growing company, Cigna can sometimes seem overwhelming to the untrained eye.

pros: Great salary very little work to do (overstaffed). If you're looking for a job that isn't challenging and pays well take mine.
cons:
The facility I work in has manager who barely is mentally or physically present enough to manage anything... 
Communication amongst departments and from management downward is virtually non-existent. I've worked for fast food companies that are better organized

pros: There is a lot of opportunity to work at home and it is an expanding and changing industry. The building and grounds were amazing.
cons: Management was not open to difficulties outside of work. Felt like I had been pushed out of the position. My last two projects were not graded and I felt as though I was improving greatly. No empathy from manager, poor communication between training and management. Felt I was set as an example. Favoritism was definitely shown.

job_title: Customer Service Analyst in Eden Prairie, MN
pros: Ability to move up in the company, can work overtime, supportive co-workers, good 401K, stock options and extra perks, yearly raises for those eligible, decent PTO balance
cons: Benefits are not great (Health Insurance wise, high deductible plans), sick time or unplanned time off is not good, some "cliques" in management which makes it hard to trust them all the time

pros: Work from home is the only thing good about this place
cons: Discrimination, toxic managers, narcissistic bosses. Managers do their best to keep the good people down, will manipulate you to feel like you’re the worst employee. Many are now in therapy for it.

job_title: RN Case Manager in East Pittsburgh, PA
pros:
Work at home
Pay is above average (you'll earn it)
cons:
Benefits are high with high deductible, copay and out of pocket costs (Cigna can and should do better)
Micromanaging good people into the ground
Promotions not based on skill or ability

review_title: Not a best place to work
pros: Job security, does provide flex work hours, has a covered parking garage, central location, easy to get to from home.
cons: Very high stress, case loads are too hight.  Hard work does not guarantee good compensations or promotions.  Micro management, not a place you can think out side of the box.

pros: conceptually- promising ideas.  top-down messages-  exciting and engaging.  theoretically-  healthy work life balance.  talented co-workers.  interesting educational opportunities- tele-conferences, orientation and otherwise.
cons: major disconnect between corporate message and management interpretation.  unrealistic expectations regarding productivity and time.  difficult (NON-intuitive) systems- that do NOT communicate.  turnover.

review_title: Company overall is a good company to work for. But, you have to watch out for the supervisors of your department.
pros: Your yearly salary is very good.
cons: Your direct supervisors does not listen to your concerns and does not help with questions. They expect you to do the work with no assistance.

job_title: Prior Authorization Specialist in Nashville, TN
pros: Easy job for a decent amount of money. Entry level for certified pharmacy techs.
cons:
Cubicle job at it's finest. Sit in a box, answer the phone, type the conversation into the program on the computer in front of you. Repeat.

They also let temps go with NO warning. "Don't come in tomorrow, we're all set." I wasn't even allowed to get all of my stuff back from my desk. One of at least 5 people they chopped spur of the moment.

job_title: LTD Claim Manager in Dallas, TX
pros:
due to the high turnover, you gain seniority fast 
bought time off is great 
involved with the local community through service and philanthropy
cons:
LTD claim managers DO NOT get flexible schedule or work from home option
work/life balance is awful. way too much work and the work is never-ending due to the high turnover  
management really lacks business ethics, it's all about reporting that looks good
employees feel like a number, makes you feel small in a corporate environment

review_title: Company has entered a phase of total chaos
pros: Great people work here. I have worked on over 5 different teams the 20 years I have worked there. I have many good friends.
cons:
Sadly no longer the company it was when I joined. No job security in IT. Constantly outsourcing more work and laying people off or forcing early retirement. Cigna does this regardless of years service or skill set. Anything to cut cost.

IT teams constantly change, so in the past you may have worked with teams that knew software. Now people are constantly moved between teams or leave.

job_title: Senior Claims Processor in Denison, TX
pros: Great pay, amazing coworkers, awesome supervisor. There's a really good support system in place.
cons: Some of the SOPs are poorly worded, and too many of the QC's lack the knowledge or experience to help processors, when they have a question or concern over a claim.

review_title: HIS do the work sales guys wont
job_title: Health Improvement Strategist in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great value and mission. David Cordani believes in the company and improving individuals health and well being. Long employee training. Job security. Market standings. Product's unique to Cigna - no other carriers can provide level funding.
cons: Office politics and culture.  Health Improvement team has to do the work the Sales team doesn't want to do. Half the job is doing Open Enrollments.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Plano, TX
pros: The only pro was being salaried.
cons: There is nothing worth wasting your time over at Cigna. People are dropping like flies left and right, the trainees are becoming the trainers so the blind are leading the blind. Management is by far the worst nurses I’ve ever worked with in my life. All your personal and pay information is spread around the office and upper Mgmt does nothing. I guess when the director leaves that should tell you something.

review_title: A great company but corporate is not for me
job_title: Senior Care Associate in Eden Prairie, MN
pros: Gave a lot of opportunities for employees to advance in the company and great education benefits. Has a lot of work at home opportunities and a fun work environment on site.
cons: Worked in a call center environment which can be very draining. Also felt very restricted by company policy and scripts which seemed to interfere with actually connecting with what the customer needs.

job_title: Billing & Account Services Associate in Chattanooga, TN
pros: Fair wages with potential to advance, good benefits including pension and 401k , sufficient paid time off.  Pleasant environment.  Some positions have the opportunity to work from home.  This is the best company I have had the pleasure to work for.
cons: Can be stressful at times but overall I enjoyed my time with the company.  Wish I was still there.  Laid off due to consolidation .

review_title: Great place to work, however the burn-out rate can be high.
job_title: Health Educator in Eden Prairie, MN
pros: Great Benefits, Great Salary, Great Teammates, Great middle management. Great place to move up if you are interested in pursuing corporate management or corporate leadership. Work at home may be an option based on performance.
cons:
Metrics driven job. Back to back phone calls without adequate breaks (for some departments). Unevenly distributed workload among teammates.
Primarily a sedentary job.

job_title: District Sales Manager in Tucson, AZ
pros:
-Freedom to set my own schedule
-Unlimited earning potential
-Lifetime vested residual income
-Company has strong leadership and really cares about its producers.
cons:
-100% Commission, so no base salary
-As an independent contractor, no one is going ot force you to go to work, which is tough for some people
-Primary method of prospecting is residential cold-calling and referrals, which means the most productive hours are 5-9pm.

pros: Progressive company, compensation is comparable for similar IT jobs.
cons: Benefits are good, could be better!  Other similar companies offer payments to a cash retirement acct (in addition to 401K).  For a healthcare company, you would think coverage would be better or subsidised more.

pros: I like the department I work in. Management is very organized and knowledgeable. The pay is ok. Not many pros outside of that
cons: Health Benefits are absolutely horrible and I wouldn't suggest this job to anyone that has any sort of medical condition The medical benefits are horrible. This company should be ashamed of offering their employees such horrible health benefits, meanwhile they're  providing amazing health benefits to the companies they sell too.

review_title: Worked at Express Scripts, now CIGNA.  Different environment.

pros: Work life balance was great.
cons: At every company your boss makes the difference.  Get a good one and you are golden.  If you don't....  But there are a lot of really good people there.  The environment is slow paced.

job_title: Senior Software Developer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: I've just been with CIGNA for 6 months but so far so good. The decision to freeze salaries this year was disappointing but not completely unexpected.  It seems to be a very bureaucratic company but probably no more so than any other big company
cons: Declining membership causes constant budget pressure. No travel, no training. Also, ironically, the insurance coverage is average at best. Not nearly as good as my last company.

pros: It is a great entry level opportunity.  Great work environment depending on the area you get to work. People are nice.
cons: Middle and upper management is severely lacking.   No support for advancement. Nepotism is the norm. Pay is on the lower end for the amount of education and experience expected.

review_title: Great Company but My department has serious issues.
pros:
It is 7 minutes away from home. 
It is a well respected company
It is know part of Cigna
cons:
No advancement opportunities 
clickish management promotion is based on if you are liked not on your skills and education

job_title: RN Case Manager in Raleigh, NC
pros: A great place to work with case managers who center their attention on doing what is in the best interest for the customers.
cons: They are currently going through restructuring with many challenges as well as opportunities ahead.  This restructuring comes with many uncertainties for the case managers.

job_title: Applications Development Specialist in Bloomfield, CT
pros: I have worked for a few large companies and Cigna is by far the best place I have worked thus far. The environment is fairly relaxed and the company invests in their employees well-being.  This results in higher employee moral and more productivity. The work is interesting and challenging, and management welcomes feedback and is receptive to new ideas.
cons: No significant or out of the ordinary cons.

pros: Significant vacation time and some flexibility
cons: Salary is not at market value. I have seen temps with less experience get hired in after temp status is up at more than tenured employees

pros: I liked that they spent 2 weeks training and then allowed you to shadow for a few weeks. I had high hopes of working here when I learned that so many people had worked at Cigna for 10 or more years.
cons: I didn't care for the burn 'em and churn 'em mentality.  Suggestions were not encouraged, apparently suggestions were construed as pushback.
